alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 27 at 4:50PM MDT until May 27 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... This does NOT include the city of Cheyenne. * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 449 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Cheyenne to 9 miles southeast of South Greeley, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Hillsdale and Burns. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 367 and 385. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
